dt: {bc}the soul of a dead person believed to be an inhabitant of the unseen world or to appear to the living in bodily likeness
{bc}a false image in a photographic negative or on a television screen caused especially by reflection
{bc}a red blood cell that has lost its hemoglobin

et: Middle English {it}gost, gast{/it}, from Old English {it}gāst{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}geist{/it} spirit, Sanskrit {it}heḍa{/it} anger
shortdef: the seat of life or intelligence : soul
a disembodied soul; especially : the soul of a dead person believed to be an inhabitant of the unseen world or to appear to the living in bodily likeness

dt: {bc}to cut off all contact with (someone) abruptly and usually without explanation {bc}to subject (someone, such as a former romantic partner) to ghosting {dx}see {dxt|ghosting||2}{/dx}

dt.t: No one wants to be {wi}ghosted{/wi}, mostly because it sucks to admit that the person you gushed about last week is now pretending you don't exist …

shortdef: to cut off all contact with (someone) abruptly and usually without explanation : to subject (someone, such as a former romantic partner) to ghosting

dt: {bc}a group dance of a late 19th century American Indian messianic cult believed to promote the return of the dead and the restoration of traditional ways of life

shortdef: a group dance of a late 19th century American Indian messianic cult believed to promote the return of the dead and the restoration of traditional ways of life

dt: {bc}a gun that lacks a serial number by which it can be identified and that is typically assembled by the user (as from purchased or homemade components)

dt.t: {wi}Ghost guns{/wi}, cobbled together with various parts often purchased separately, are popular among hobbyists and firearms enthusiasts.
The issue centers on so-called {wi}ghost guns{/wi}, which consist of untraceable parts that can be ordered online and then, with a little finishing work, assembled into a working firearm.
Even so, they haven't been outlawed; buying or selling a {wi}ghost gun{/wi} is illegal, but making one remains kosher under US gun control laws.

shortdef: a gun that lacks a serial number by which it can be identified and that is typically assembled by the user (as from purchased or homemade components)

dt: {bc}a commercial cooking facility used for the preparation of food consumed off the premises

dt.t: {wi}Ghost kitchens{/wi} host food establishments, usually fast-casual, that make meals that can be purchased exclusively with a delivery app …

{wi}Ghost kitchens{/wi}, which have no storefronts or dining rooms, are the hottest thing going during the pandemic. Some are all-new kitchens created to house multiple companies. Others … are new brands added to existing restaurants that seek additional business.
This is what [Eric] Greenspan did with his own {wi}ghost kitchen{/wi} brands—multiple cuisine styles made from the same basic supplies, all from a single location.

shortdef: a commercial cooking facility used for the preparation of food consumed off the premises —called also cloud kitchen, dark kitchen

dt: {bc}a small, extremely hot {d_link|chili|chili} pepper of southern Asia that is a hybrid between two species ({it}Capsicum chinensis{/it} and {it}Capsicum frutescens{/it})

dt.t: … the aforementioned potstickers come with a lethal house-made sauce of habaneros and {wi}ghost peppers{/wi} (I managed one tiny spoonful before my tongue went numb).

{wi}Ghost pepper{/wi}, a name for the bhut jolokia grown mainly in northeast India, is so powerful that the Indian military announced earlier this year that it was going to "weaponize" the peppers for hand grenades.

et: translation of a presumed Assamese compound noun {it}bhüt-zolokiya{/it}
See etymology and note at {et_link|bhut jolokia|bhut jolokia}.
shortdef: a small, extremely hot chili pepper of southern Asia that is a hybrid between two species (Capsicum chinensis and Capsicum frutescens) —called also bhut jolokia

dt: {bc}a tale based on imagination rather than fact

shortdef: a tale based on imagination rather than fact

dt: {bc}a once-flourishing town wholly or nearly deserted usually as a result of the exhaustion of some natural resource

shortdef: a once-flourishing town wholly or nearly deserted usually as a result of the exhaustion of some natural resource

shortdef: a word form never in established usage
